message_2:
To simplify the given rational expression, we can first factor out the common factor in the numerator:

(12x^2 - 6x) / (6x) = 6x(2x - 1) / (6x)

Now, we can cancel out the common factor of 6x in both the numerator and the denominator:

6x(2x - 1) / (6x) = (2x - 1)

So, the simplified rational expression is:

2x - 1
